alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Cedar; Knox; Pierce; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 2:50AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wayne, Pierce, northeastern Antelope, Knox and Cedar Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 249 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Plainview, or 19 miles northeast of Neligh, moving northeast at 45 mph. Another storm was located near Verdigre. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartington, Pierce, Plainview, Creighton, Bloomfield, Laurel, Randolph, Osmond, Crofton, Wausa, Verdigre, Coleridge, Winside, Niobrara, Santee, Hadar, Hoskins, Carroll, Wynot and Fordyce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Nebraska.
